@mikulaja @psb_dc @PayPal Bringing a POS device to the table is becoming more common. The problem is that many servers don't know how to process mobile payments.  I've done more than a few 'classes' in the restaurant.

@leimer @mikulaja @dmgerbino @psb_dc @PayPal We need to rethink credit on many fronts. Having a small line of credit on your mobile device accessible at any time with multiple payment options.

@pdpsingha @BrettKing @WearablesExpert @MarshaCollier @jaypalter In Central and South America and Africa, retail distribution of banking services is commonplace. Can even open accounts at a retailer.

@jameswester @rshevlin @Clagett @Chime I don't think the story investigated the claims very deeply. We saw legacy banks make many of the same judgments erroneously. My thought was that there needs to be a deeper analysis of the issue.

@JCBradford @PayPal We saw it in China. The ability to view utility and rent payment consistency, stability of banking relationships (duration), even cell phone usage were ways to help determine credit worthiness.

@rshevlin @Clagett I think this may be an example of poor execution of a response to a 'major' problem at @Chime. History (while brief) will most likely see a 'quick' resolution in those cases that are legitimate. 

I put the benefit of the doubt in favor of @Chime.
